senses.sense_definition: The experience of long-term exhaustion and diminished interest, especially in one's career.

examples.text: She decided to take a long vacation to recover from severe <w>burnout</w>.
Many healthcare workers suffer from <w>burnout</w> due to long shifts and high stress.

senses.sense_definition: Use of the throttle to spin the wheels of a vehicle being held stationary, causing the spinning tires to produce smoke and burn rubber.

examples.text: The driver celebrated his victory by doing a massive <w>burnout</w> on the track.
You could smell the burnt rubber immediately after the car performed a <w>burnout</w>.

senses.sense_definition: A person who has the experience of long-term exhaustion and diminished interest.

examples.text: After ten years in that stressful job, he felt like a total <w>burnout</w>.
The company tries to support employees so they do not turn into <w>burnouts</w>.

senses.sense_definition: Someone whose brains have figuratively been burned out by drugs.

examples.text: He used to be a brilliant student, but now people just consider him a <w>burnout</w>.
Don't act like a <w>burnout</w>; you need to get your life together.

senses.sense_definition: The failure of an electrical device, usually through overheating due to the application of excessive power.

examples.text: A sudden voltage spike caused the <w>burnout</w> of the main circuit board.
We need to replace the bulb immediately to prevent a complete <w>burnout</w> of the fixture.

senses.sense_definition: The shutoff of a rocket motor after exhausting its fuel.

examples.text: The rocket reached its maximum velocity just moments before <w>burnout</w>.
Engineers monitored the telemetry closely until the stage <w>burnout</w> was confirmed.
